questions.question_text:
You need to update inventory data for a company's warehouse.
Which two record types can you use to update the inventory? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
The other two answers literally makes no sense.

questions.question_text:
You are a sales representative for a company that sells furniture. You collaborate with an engineering team and a design team to support customer proposals.
The latest versions of all proposals must be available to both teams. Team members must be able to edit the proposals in real time.
You need to attach a proposal to a customer record.
Which mechanism should you use to attach the proposal?

discussion.content: The key point is team member can edit the proposals in real time, for Timeline & Template, you cannot collaborate.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales. The company creates sales proposals as PDF documents.
The company wants multiple users to access the latest version of a sales proposal in Dynamics 365 Sales. Users must be able to attach notes to the proposal.
You need to recommend an app for the company.
Which app should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct,
Microsoft Teams: This application allows users to collaborate with other team members and connect to the Dynamics 365 Sales application data.
URL:https://docs.microsoft.com/dynamics365/teams-integration/teams-install-app

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A customer purchases Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365 Sales.
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
You are designing reports for a pharmacy. The pharmacy uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
Match each tool to the reporting requirements.
Instructions: To answer, drag the appropriate tool from the column on the left to the requirements on the right. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
The first question should be PowerBI because:
- Users are stakeholders. I assumed that they don't have a Dynamics license.
- Updated Excel (not static) needs the license to refresh any time you open the document.
- In PowerBI you can grant access to external users.

Therefore, I would go with PowerBI.
Use Power BI to pull data from Dataverse and display it in Excel without needing a direct connection to Dynamics 365. so My vote goes to Power BI for the first requirement.

Hereâ€™s how Copilot would match the tools to the reporting requirements:

Power BI: This tool is ideal for stakeholders who do not have access to the environment but need to view up-to-date business data. Power BI can connect to Dynamics 365 Sales, extract data, and present it in a visually appealing and easy-to-understand format. Reports can be shared with stakeholders who can view them on any device.
Dynamics 365 Sales Dashboard: This tool is perfect for pharmacists who need a list of the number of orders filled and to fill the next day, week, and month as well as a list of prescription drugs that are out of stock. The dashboard provides real-time data and can be customized to show specific metrics, making it easy for pharmacists to track and manage orders.

from the link mentioned to share the dynamic excel with someone, he should be in the same domain, so the first point is PowerBI (You can email a dynamic Excel file or store it as a shared file if the recipients are in the same domain as you. When recipients open the dynamic file, they only see the data that they have permission to view.)
ChatGPT said the 2nd Question is also Power BI??
pretty sure first one is power bi.

It says Business data not reports
Excel is the included option in dynamics, so the first choice would be excel

comments.content: Export your app data to an Excel dynamic worksheet to get the most up-to-date information from your app. When you export your data to an Excel dynamic worksheet and then make changes to your data in the app, you can use the refresh feature in Excel to get the latest information from the app. because of this then the choice should be Excel

It does not say Dynamic or Static, so Excel is a bit unclear. PowerBI will show data that you are authorised to see in D365, so, if you do not have D365, then you will see nothing. Plugin won't help, Dashboard requires the license. So, the closest correct answer is Excel
in case of dynamic excel, one would still need license to environment which is clearly not available in the scenario. Hence would go with Power BI instead.
